messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] continuing Habaki
messages.msgSnippet: I might try that -- actually, I only have the new one here. The old one is at Yoshikawa s waiting for a mount to be made in the next century or so. I also
messages.messageBody:
I might try that -- actually, I only have the new one here. The old one
is at Yoshikawa's waiting for a mount to be made in the next century or
so. I also found the Muromachi period mounts we were talking about
months ago. I will try getting something into a folder.

Gordon

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] continuing Habaki
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Gordon. Any chance of seeing pix of the two side by side? Matt Z Recruiting Services “Zurich Toren” Muzenstraat 89 2511 WB Den Haag T: +31 70
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Gordon. Any chance of seeing pix of the two side by side?

Matt



Z Recruiting Services
Zurich Toren Muzenstraat 89
2511 WB Den Haag
T: +31 70 4262273
F: +31 70 4262111
W: zrecruiting.com
E: info@...
Kijk ook op monsterboard.nl, jobbingmall.nl en
nationalevacaturebank.nl voor actuele vacatures!



-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
Van: Gordon Robson [mailto:robsongo@...]
Verzonden: zondag 18 januari 2004 3:16
Aan: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Onderwerp: Re: [nihontostudy] continuing Habaki


I have two such habaki, one old and one by Miyajima sensei's father to
match the old one. The "scratches are in the shape of peonies, thus
botan. Ganseki means rocks or crags, I would think crags.

Gordon

messages.msgSnippet: I have two such habaki, one old and one by Miyajima sensei s father to match the old one. The scratches are in the shape of peonies, thus botan. Ganseki means
messages.messageBody:
I have two such habaki, one old and one by Miyajima sensei's father to
match the old one. The "scratches are in the shape of peonies, thus
botan. Ganseki means rocks or crags, I would think crags.

Gordon

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] continuing Habaki
messages.msgSnippet: Guys can anyone explain what this is: Botan-yujo Habaki? It is the third one on the top row illustrated on Mishina s website. Also is it correct that the
messages.messageBody:
Guys can anyone explain what this is: Botan-yujo Habaki? It is the third
one on the top row illustrated on Mishina's website.

Also is it correct that the Ganseki-habaki is decorated to simulate
rockes? This one is the third on the bottom row.

Matt




Z Recruiting Services
"Zurich Toren" Muzenstraat 89
2511 WB Den Haag
T: +31 70 4262273
F: +31 70 4262111
W: zrecruiting.com
E: info@...

-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
Van: Richard Turner [mailto:ikkanshi@...]
Verzonden: zondag 18 januari 2004 1:53
Aan: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Onderwerp: [nihontostudy] continuing Habaki


Kenji Mishina has a page about Hiroshi Miyajima and samples of his work.

http://www007.upp.so-net.ne.jp/m-kenji/samples_of_habaki.htm

Rich
